name: federated-upgrade

datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: secfabgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: secfabgrp

help: Coordinate federated upgrades within the Security Fabric.

options.name: disabled
options.help: No federated upgrade has been configured.
options.label: Disabled
options.description: No federated upgrade has been configured

options.name: initialized
options.help: The upgrade has been configured.
options.label: Initialized
options.description: The upgrade has been configured

options.name: downloading
options.help: The image is downloading in preparation for the upgrade.
options.label: Downloading
options.description: The image is downloading in preparation for the upgrade

options.name: device-disconnected
options.help: The image downloads are complete, but one or more devices have disconnected.
options.label: Device Disconnected
options.description: The image downloads are complete, but one or more devices have disconnected

options.name: ready
options.help: The image download finished and the upgrade is pending.
options.label: Ready
options.description: The image download finished and the upgrade is pending

options.name: coordinating
options.help: The upgrade is coordinating with other running upgrades.
options.label: Coordinating
options.description: The upgrade is coordinating with other running upgrades

options.name: staging
options.help: The upgrade is confirmed and images are being staged.
options.label: Staging
options.description: The upgrade is confirmed and images are being staged

options.name: final-check
options.help: The upgrade is ready and final checks are in progress.
options.label: Final Check
options.description: The upgrade is ready and final checks are in progress

options.name: upgrade-devices
options.help: The upgrade is ready and devices are being rebooted.
options.label: Upgrade Devices
options.description: The upgrade is ready and devices are being rebooted

options.name: cancelled
options.help: The upgrade was cancelled due to the tree not being ready.
options.label: Cancelled
options.description: The upgrade was cancelled due to the tree not being ready

options.name: confirmed
options.help: The upgrade was confirmed and reboots are running.
options.label: Confirmed
options.description: The upgrade was confirmed and reboots are running

options.name: done
options.help: The upgrade completed successfully.
options.label: Done
options.description: The upgrade completed successfully

options.name: failed
options.help: The upgrade failed due to a local issue.
options.label: Failed
options.description: The upgrade failed due to a local issue

source.name: source
source.help: Source that set up the federated upgrade config.

options.name: user
options.help: Upgrade configured based on user input.
options.label: User
options.description: Upgrade configured based on user input

options.name: auto-firmware-upgrade
options.help: Upgrade configured by the FortiGuard auto-firmware-upgrade feature.
options.label: Auto Firmware Upgrade
options.description: Upgrade configured by the FortiGuard auto-firmware-upgrade feature

options.name: forced-upgrade
options.help: Forced upgrade due to no support contract or end-of-life firmware.
options.label: Forced Upgrade
options.description: Forced upgrade due to no support contract or end-of-life firmware

options.name: none
options.help: No failure.
options.label: None
options.description: No failure

options.name: internal
options.help: An internal error occurred.
options.label: Internal
options.description: An internal error occurred

options.name: timeout
options.help: The upgrade timed out.
options.label: Timeout
options.description: The upgrade timed out

options.name: device-type-unsupported
options.help: The device type was not supported by the FortiGate.
options.label: Device Type Unsupported
options.description: The device type was not supported by the FortiGate

options.name: download-failed
options.help: The image could not be downloaded.
options.label: Download Failed
options.description: The image could not be downloaded

options.name: device-missing
options.help: The device was disconnected from the FortiGate.
options.label: Device Missing
options.description: The device was disconnected from the FortiGate

options.name: version-unavailable
options.help: An image matching the device and version could not be found.
options.label: Version Unavailable
options.description: An image matching the device and version could not be found

options.name: staging-failed
options.help: The image could not be pushed to the device.
options.label: Staging Failed
options.description: The image could not be pushed to the device

options.name: reboot-failed
options.help: The device could not be rebooted.
options.label: Reboot Failed
options.description: The device could not be rebooted

options.name: device-not-reconnected
options.help: The device did not reconnect after rebooting.
options.label: Device Not Reconnected
options.description: The device did not reconnect after rebooting

options.name: node-not-ready
options.help: A device in the Security Fabric tree was not ready.
options.label: Node Not Ready
options.description: A device in the Security Fabric tree was not ready

options.name: no-final-confirmation
options.help: The coordinating FortiGate did not confirm the upgrade.
options.label: No Final Confirmation
options.description: The coordinating FortiGate did not confirm the upgrade

options.name: no-confirmation-query
options.help: A downstream FortiGate did not initiate final confirmation.
options.label: No Confirmation Query
options.description: A downstream FortiGate did not initiate final confirmation

options.name: config-error-log-nonempty
options.help: Configuration errors encountered during the upgrade.
options.label: Config Error Log Nonempty
options.description: Configuration errors encountered during the upgrade

options.name: csf-tree-not-supported
options.help: The Security Fabric is disabled on the root FortiGate
options.label: Csf Tree Not Supported
options.description: The Security Fabric is disabled on the root FortiGate    firmware-changed:Firmware changed after the upgrade was set up

options.name: firmware-changed
options.help: Firmware changed after the upgrade was set up.
options.label: Firmware Changed

options.name: node-failed
options.help: A device in the Security Fabric tree failed.
options.label: Node Failed
options.description: A device in the Security Fabric tree failed

options.name: image-missing
options.help: The firmware image is missing and download is not allowed
options.label: Image Missing
options.description: The firmware image is missing and download is not allowed

failure-device.name: failure-device
failure-device.help: Serial number of the node to include.

next-path-index.name: next-path-index
next-path-index.help: The index of the next image to upgrade to.

ignore-signing-errors.name: ignore-signing-errors
ignore-signing-errors.help: Allow/reject use of FortiGate firmware images that are unsigned.

options.name: enable
options.help: Allow use of FortiGate images that are unsigned.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Allow use of FortiGate images that are unsigned

options.name: disable
options.help: Reject use of FortiGate images that are unsigned.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Reject use of FortiGate images that are unsigned

ha-reboot-controller.name: ha-reboot-controller
ha-reboot-controller.help: Serial number of the FortiGate unit that will control the reboot process for the federated upgrade of the HA cluster.

known-ha-members.name: known-ha-members
known-ha-members.help: Known members of the HA cluster. If a member is missing at upgrade time, the upgrade will be cancelled.

initial-version.name: initial-version
initial-version.help: Firmware version when the upgrade was set up.

node-list.name: node-list
node-list.help: Nodes which will be included in the upgrade.

serial.name: serial
serial.help: Serial number of the node to include.

timing.name: timing
timing.help: Run immediately or at a scheduled time.

options.name: immediate
options.help: Begin the upgrade immediately.
options.label: Immediate

options.name: scheduled
options.help: Begin the upgrade at a configured time.
options.label: Scheduled

maximum-minutes.name: maximum-minutes
maximum-minutes.help: Maximum number of minutes to allow for immediate upgrade preparation.

time.name: time
time.help: Scheduled upgrade execution time in UTC (hh:mm yyyy/mm/dd UTC).

setup-time.name: setup-time
setup-time.help: Upgrade preparation start time in UTC (hh:mm yyyy/mm/dd UTC).

upgrade-path.name: upgrade-path
upgrade-path.help: Fortinet OS image versions to upgrade through in major-minor-patch format, such as 7-0-4.
